title: Hole

verbs: To complete a hole by sinking the ball.
To drive into a hole, as an animal, or a billiard ball or golf ball.
Hit the ball into the hole
nouns: An opening into or through something

description: A round, black, cartoon-styled hole, as a manhole or a hole (cup) in golf. May be used to represent various types of literal or figurative holes, e.g., black holes, rabbit holes.
apple_vendor_description: This hole emoji on Apple devices is a striking depiction of negative space, rendered with deep, shadowy depths that create a strong sense of three-dimensionality. Its edges are softly rounded with subtle highlights, giving it a smooth, almost polished appearance despite its emptiness. It visually communicates a void, a missing piece, or a point of entry, often used humorously to signify something has disappeared or to express a feeling of being lost or incomplete.
